979C8AC30271417FBFCB990B413D3A1C.description: Reflect on personal linguistic and cultural identity.

0ACBAFAA8681405AA9FD740ED8A1A76E.description: Explore worldwide programming and initiatives that support Spanish communities, programming and language.

29DCAA2FF6B344FC81EFA1C9DE541485.description: Explore international career fields for which the ability to speak Spanish is a requirement or an asset (e.g., the Red Cross, Olympics, United Nations, business, interpreter, international government, education, reporters and Doctors without Borders).

01E1BD33B7854F679A8088F6B4509C9B.description: Investigate international scholarship, study and travel opportunities (e.g., VolSol) available to Spanish-speaking Canadian students.

72CF2B2887D64020A5EDBE7A3D07C670.description: Research global opportunities to further personal Spanish language learning (e.g., postsecondary programs, international cultural exchanges and organizations).

9BF42BC7956441ACBDA2369826D38799.description: Investigate opportunities to communicate in Spanish at the global level (e.g., Spanish social media groups, blogging, corresponding in Spanish with people from various parts of the Spanish-speaking world).

46B9C476FDA14CA09A2F3E61ADBBB6ED.description: Discuss the different linguistic and cultural perspectives on world issues (e.g., violence, sexuality, the environment and social media).

17ECF5F7155644FD9CB2CE425E4B5AAD.description: Explore international summer work opportunities and practicum placements for Spanishspeaking students.

D758A912955349748D9B87FA49D58FA4.description: Identify study opportunities at Spanish-speaking universities and technical colleges (e.g., National University of Mexico City, Spanish Immersion in Costa Rica and Spanish Immersion courses with Buenos Aires Institute) open to international students.

E896ADE0E6BC45BEA6766CE7EE91DE5F.description: Explain how personal understanding of a culture might be enhanced through language learning.

9FFB857AF8924D48977FEA98050CF3A9.description: Investigate international opportunities to use and develop Spanish language skills and explore personal identity as a Spanish language learner.

CF17FB0050CC4D0EBAE7AE4B3F137EBE.description: Articulate typical attitudes and cultural-linguistic world view of Spanish speakers to issues such as: the environment (recycling, nuclear and green energy and climate change); urban sprawl; public transportation; and, political organization and involvement.

09A6F0CFD2A84B648816A1A85843F4C1.description: Investigate the impact of Spanish communities’ geographical locations on their local culture and ethnic diversity.

5CB0D2584EA040CDBD1E0BB8381F39C7.description: Examine and compare elements of Spanish culture and heritage (e.g., food, the arts, celebrations, community, traditions, language, history) in various parts of the world.

9CB4C3343D0B42BBB20B9DDDD6AA4958.description: Inquire about Spanish culture and heritage (e.g., the arts, celebrations, community, traditions, language, history and food) in various parts of the world by: reading, listening to or viewing tourist information or facts about Spanish-speaking countries or regions around the world; researching Spanish festivals, events and organizations (e.g., La Tomatina, Día de los Muertos, San Fermin and Santiago de Cuba); and, investigating cultural places or historic sites (e.g., Teotihuacatan and La Sagrada Familia).

06FDF3F6E4404D548798895F3FD8B6F4.description: Discuss the economic impact of Spain within Europe and on other countries around the world.

4D03131648E44E54B7AF199913257EA7.description: Compare dialectical pronunciation and vocabulary differences within Spanish and in standard usage in other parts of the world.

24F7B53C30DC497E9752938CC1C037CF.description: Describe the traditional and cultural contributions of Spanish-speakers (e.g., Pablo Picasso, Antonio Banderas, Rigoberta Menchu, Manuela Saenz and Isabel Allende).

4D0DB2AF998E464597EB5A6C718CE689.description: Research significant historical and contemporary events (e.g., Aztec and Inca empires, independence from Spain and Portugal, construction of Panama Canal, Cuban and Mexican revolution) that affect Spanish communities.

D8184C2A44F144C58AC53003EA2981CD.description: Identify Spanish-speaking countries (e.g., Spain, Argentina, Mexico and Nicaragua) in the world.

BF4E9BFD3B994787BED15CE5FC21964F.description: Explore historical and contemporary elements, and the cultural and linguistic diversity, of Spanish cultures around the world.

3FEBE5A1079145F893DBE740F5B4C088.description: Incorporate the following in written productions: evidence of planning (e.g., narrative writing organizers and bullet journals); clear purpose; consideration of audience; organization (e.g., introduction, development of ideas, conclusion and flow of ideas); appropriate tone; rich context-specific vocabulary; language suitable to text type; and, linguistic conventions.

F047B7CECD1440C1B78478927C08F8CF.description: Research, organize and present information in expository texts (e.g., biography on Spanish artist and essay on traditional Spanish foods).

7AD9ECA68A8344BC9F6DB65902B9CF87.description: Experiment with a variety of text types (e.g., letters, schedules, lists, questionnaires, reports and social media posts).

C7AAA8E5B1664DFC9367D609BF75E992.description: Express personal opinions in a persuasive text (e.g., travel blogs and editorials).

8A7973534674453E94B9B80233E7C209.description: Create a comic strip with Spanish dialogue.

2E1A092ABAE54E19BA244C8718D492EA.description: Compose emails requesting information on topics related to future plans (e.g., travel or exchange possibilities, post-secondary education and career opportunities).

DE1C29FABA114D7685AFC65DAB912257.description: Write a message to convey the details (e.g., time and location) of an appointment.

8BA327C1790C483E9295B81B954DBCCF.description: Complete a questionnaire or résumé with relevant details (e.g., education, skills, work experience and interests).

3C511229C1B742FB8661EA2EBACEAD49.description: Produce a variety of written Spanish texts related to big ideas such as: global Spanish communities; media and technology; and, future plans.

2BF7F99237ED42A3B1753D7E7710CF6C.description: Produce a variety of written non-fiction and fiction Spanish texts to express ideas, extend knowledge of the world, achieve objectives and for enjoyment.

34D49B696C694C25AB4D2F3C5771E6D8.description: Incorporate the following in oral productions: evidence of planning (e.g., narrative writing organizers and bullet journals); clear purpose; consideration of audience; organization (e.g., introduction, development of ideas, conclusion and flow of ideas); appropriate tone; rich context-specific vocabulary; language suitable to text type; and  linguistic conventions.

13279D6BAB37431F8F79F57099E9A78C.description: Present information on a topic of interest (e.g., sports, music and travel destination) using a variety of visuals (e.g., charts, maps, diagrams, pictures and gestures) while speaking.

A70A070DD9AD4C13AE7DE081CB543BAF.description: Persuade audience of a perspective using convincing details and supporting arguments.

CDE1EB76C1C4485EA2A3ED1B1686C0F3.description: Defend opinions with supporting arguments in a debate.

BE8EAA4DA6454D0F915400F922A914F0.description: Present stories, poetry and monologues with expression, intonation and enunciation.

4E5975D03AB24A26AA29F6F744002C9B.description: Conduct an interview by posing, and responding to, direct questions.

D29BC372D20D4C759C252D22140D5614.description: Provide detailed directions to a location.

491F48E741AA4613936698289031DB41.description: Act as a middle person in informal situations by relaying basic information from English to short, simple Spanish and vice versa.

0A74EE6D16754C25BE9A3C82052201A6.description: Experiment with oral language to communicate emotions, opinions and advice.

BC5A8514CF1D4C15BDB47652CE5EF779.description: Generate conversations by posing and responding to questions on a variety of topics, such as travel experiences, school aspirations and entertainment preferences.

CEA1CD51BA6B4FB98E741D212DCC7E3D.description: Contribute to spontaneous conversations on familiar topics with multiple participants.

FF83D19646A444528253A57CC0246C76.description: Produce a variety of oral Spanish texts related to big ideas such as: global Spanish communities; media and technology; and, future plans.

661F9BC3A23B4F588607DF30C7FB26CB.description: Produce a variety of oral non-fiction and fiction Spanish texts to express ideas, extend knowledge of the world, achieve objectives and for enjoyment.

54C5F14C7BCD4611AAE6B4AB0F3C4DA7.description: Share and justify emotional and personal reactions (e.g., empathy, surprise, appreciation, deference or disgust) to a variety of print texts.

49466B9A44184BEEAA6EB73B5A481236.description: React to written texts with questions of elaboration and alternate points of view.

7025EDBEC61145B9A51BA122042F23F5.description: Analyze persuasive print texts (e.g., posters, graphs, charts and pictures) for bias.

041497A9678A4B1A92D9DF5EFD7B8019.description: Discuss the theme and supporting elements of written texts.

52345DBC59754FA08480382FE00ED49E.description: Summarize the message and details presented in a variety of formal and informal texts, such as: personal communication (e.g., letters, text messages, e-mails and social media posts); common business documents (e.g., confirmation of flight booking, receipts and invoices); media (e.g., articles, blogs and magazines); and, expository texts on various topics (e.g., historical events, environmental issues and political perspectives).

E9F388E594884A458E815BF8366567DB.description: Follow multi-step directions to complete a task related to daily routines (e.g., following a recipe and finding a location).

1E90611317BE4417BFD20608C3844011.description: Comprehend information related to details about travel and transportation (e.g., tourist destinations, airports, cost and documentation requirements).

65789C96FCD14EDFAE3B4A2143505BCB.description: Interpret signs and notices in public venues (e.g., signs for destinations, description of amenities and hazard warnings).

7B5CF68A6B0743A6B9A1372DA7CB102F.description: Analyze the intended purpose and audience of written texts.

924BA30323BC44DE8011CD8DBB51E13E.description: Select, listen to and view a variety of written Spanish texts (e.g., bibliographies, magazine articles, travel guides, editorials and poems) that address big ideas such as: global Spanish communities; media and technology; and, future plans.

92FB230477574A34A019579B2A30AD28.description: Construct meaning of a variety of written non-fiction and fiction Spanish texts to receive information, extend knowledge of the world, achieve objectives and for enjoyment.

43E004BBB565437781BD64A23914946A.description: Investigate the source and credibility of statements made in reported speech.

8C128671F9A940319ED3ADA3EC8AF644.description: Analyze different nuances, perspectives and biases presented in oral texts.

70064D3720964F72BB94D21FB0DDD37E.description: Paraphrase the main message and supporting details presented in a variety of news reports (e.g., social media, television and radio) that include eyewitness accounts.

4513F58A74A3401CBF58DDE0F2F280E1.description: Examine the vocabulary and expressions used in oral persuasive texts (e.g., advertisements and public service announcements).

C14EDABC61D34B619BEB709DDB54411A.description: Follow a series of instructions on familiar topics (e.g., playing a game and following a recipe).

FA8536A0DF1D4C8A9762B201C8BF95F5.description: Interpret directions and announcements related to travel (e.g., flight numbers and train departure times).

379CEFBD8685468BB1A6DA7B9D15C7FA.description: Analyze the intended purpose and audience of oral texts.

C75304E5E84D48B78DD100814F81EB6B.description: Follow changes in topics during conversations on familiar topics.

71E1AC39454A4686A2F800EEF3487685.description: Discuss information presented in documentaries and formal presentations on a variety of topics such as social issues, workplace diversity, political perspectives, environmental and climate issues and historical events.

A352EC150F8C41CA83571321F001A3E4.description: Respond appropriately in spontaneous conversations on familiar themes and daily activities.

15FD60C598B74EEE949E527F5032B3A2.description: Select, listen to and view a variety of oral Spanish texts (e.g., interviews, documentaries, podcasts, and movies) that address big ideas such as: global Spanish communities; media and technology; and, future plans.

985C2945918B44C893B180FE41332D07.description: Construct meaning of a variety of oral non-fiction and fiction Spanish texts to receive information, extend knowledge of the world, achieve objectives and for enjoyment.

F0D55597AEE048B9A3C8AEECE2E77431.description: Select and use appropriate conventions of informal and formal language

C778D77E5DCD49FA9592810EB5D88417.description: Experiment with grammatical components such as: rich word choice; complex prepositions (p. ej., cerca de, encima de, lejos de, fuera de); and, complex conjunctions (p. ej., pues, entonces, sino, pero, sobre eso).

D0A188DE9AC54873AFC23D37CC207772.description: Apply knowledge of linguistic conventions to enhance communication, including: indirect object pronouns (p. ej., me, te, le); compound prepositions (p. ej., abajo de, a bordo de, a cargo de); complex prepositions (p. ej., cerca de, encima de, lejos de, fuera de); complex conjunctions (p. ej., pues, entonces, sino, pero, sobre eso); conjunctions (p. ej., mientras que, desde que, donde); and, spelling and punctuation.

E6C3478196DC406FA0F19B02CABC405C.description: Utilize the following verb conjugations: imperfect tense of irregular verbs (p. ej., hacer, ir, tener); past tense (e.g., present perfect, preterite and imperfect) of regular and irregular verbs (p.ej., compartir, escribir, viajar) and familiar verbs; past tense of pronominal / reflexive verbs (p. ej., “se despertó tarde”); conditional present tense regular and irregular verbs (p. ej., dibujar, escuchar, terminar, hacer, ir, tener); present subjunctive of regular, irregular and common verbs (p. ej., dibujar, escuchar, terminar, hacer, ir, ser, estar); present conditional tense with regular, irregular and common verbs (p. ej., hacer, ir, tener, ser, estar); future tense (p. ej., bailarás, jugaremos); and, future simple of common regular and irregular verbs (p. ej., dibujar, escuchar, terminar, hacer, ir, estar, ser).

9A09EEFE2EE442F8B40A3F3F02D204CD.description: Employ vocabulary and phrasing in oral and written texts, such as: vocabulary in context, for various text types (p. ej., los hispanohablantes en el mundo, español, identidad lingüística, las aventuras, las becas, las carreras); adverbs (p. ej., muy, fácilmente, de repente); useful phrases for various contexts and text types (p. ej., “el baile de fin de curso”, “la graduación” “subir al avión”, “desde mi punto de vista”, “Señor, muchas gracias por su consideración.”); the interrogative form with future tense (p. ej., “¿Vas a España?”, “¿Vamos a bailar allí?”); sentences with the preposition “si” (p. ej., “Si fuera rico, viajaría a España”); and, expressions (p. ej., “Qué guay”; “Genial”).

DC561532439D4F2894DCD3C4252BEC1A.description: Demonstrate, when producing oral and written texts, knowledge of Spanish language concepts including vocabulary, sentence structure and linguistic conventions.

B337FEABEF2D4A6D867FF98C90E4C908.description: Compare how language use varies in different types of oral and written texts.

30C796BA3ABE45DDA0F10B610CCCED96.description: Recognize and describe conventions of informal and formal language.

3FBE22756F1942B39427657C6206A26E.description: Examine how linguistic conventions enhance communication, including: indirect object pronouns (p. ej., me, te, le); compound prepositions (p. ej., abajo de, a bordo de, a cargo de); complex prepositions (p. ej., cerca de, encima de, lejos de, fuera de); complex conjunctions (p. ej., pues, entonces, sino, pero, sobre eso). conjunctions (p. ej., mientras que, desde que, donde); and, spelling and punctuation.

690F416AB6FB459D8AD760BA20A9045A.description: Analyze the use of the following verb conjugations: imperfect tense of irregular verbs (p. ej., hacer, ir, tener); past tense (e.g., present perfect, preterite, imperfect) of regular and irregular verbs (p.ej., compartir, escribir, viajar) and familiar verbs; past tense of pronominal and reflexive verbs (p. ej., “se despertó tarde”); conditional present tense regular and irregular verbs (p. ej., dibujar, escuchar, terminar, hacer, ir, tener); present conditional tense with regular, irregular and common verbs (p. ej., hacer, ir, tener, ser, estar); present subjunctive of irregular, regular and common verbs (p. ej., dibujar, escuchar, terminar, hacer, ir, ser, estar); and, future simple of regular, irregular and common verbs (p. ej., dibujar, escuchar, terminar, hacer, ir, estar, ser).

ED6BAC4AE416463D9DCF5AA0A3B1D679.description: Explain vocabulary and phrasing such as: vocabulary in context, for various text types (p. ej., los hispanohablantes en el mundo, español, identidad lingüística, las aventuras, las becas, las carreras); adverbs (p. ej., muy, fácilmente, de repente); useful phrases for various contexts and text types (p. ej., “el baile de fin de curso”, “la graduación”, “subir al avión”, “desde mi punto de vista”, “Señor, muchas gracias por su consideración”); the interrogative form with future tense (p. ej., “¿Vas a España?”, “¿Vamos a bailar allí?”); sentences with the preposition “si” (p. ej., “Si fuera rico, viajaría a España”); and, expressions (p. ej., “Qué guay”; “Genial”).

D22FEC4A4A7D43848012E6D35EE81F92.description: Demonstrate, when interpreting oral and written texts, knowledge of Spanish language concepts including vocabulary, sentence structure and linguistic conventions.

310258FFBED44749AAD7D48637728F0D.description: Develop interests, passion and confidence in learning Spanish by: maintaining a positive learning attitude; taking the initiative to use Spanish whenever possible; and, actively engaging in activities that help to enhance language proficiency.

E7562A0918564B2A84BE3165C6A16279.description: Maintain a learning log to: reflect on personal Spanish writing or speaking process; evaluate personal written and oral production of language; assess which language learning strategies are most effective; and, describe ways in which risk-taking furthered personal language learning.

C4A04CCC6B6449868AD8584B13CED23E.description: Employ cues (e.g., first, second and finally) to orient the audience in a longer text.

33122F2527D9440E8031C7C013413B4A.description: Apply language learning strategies to support the production of written text, such as: taking risks; using cultural references (e.g., idioms, customs, traditions and perspectives); and, activating prior knowledge, etymology and cognates for personal expression in Spanish.

42B842CB721B4A5AAD08071405B9FCFE.description: Employ oral communication and mediation strategies such as: taking risks; applying prior knowledge and cognates for personal expression in Spanish; using physical (e.g., gestures and facial expressions) and auditory (e.g., laughter, tone and volume) cues to convey meaning; practicing tongue-twisters to build fluency; demonstrating appropriate Spanish etiquette in interactions; and, paraphrasing the message in different ways to clarify intent.

0E7F4167E6974A3C828601F9C14DB2B1.description: Devise tools (e.g., charts, phrasebooks and audio files) and select resources (e.g., electronic applications and grammar reference books) to support the production of oral and written texts.

EA2C9780B1114FE3B4815F163CAD0D5D.description: Create a plan for speaking or writing using tools such as a bullet journal and a narrative writing organizer.

67F820BE6BB44F73BDA1E9CD10A56047.description: Select and apply a variety of before, during and after strategies to construct and communicate meaning when writing and speaking.

954A672824B6456B837A71097D7CDE57.description: Use the Spanish language to communicate with Spanish-speaking people in a variety of situations.

95A51A4AB3E4417B859CE5BEACE44591.description: Select and apply a variety of strategies to produce oral and written texts in Spanish and reflect on personal language learning.

F650A61CD8C344C28E6E2BD3E5B8EC6D.description: Reflect on, and evaluate, personal viewing, listening and reading strategies

ABBFFAED794C4F97B407B02AE17971D0.description: Discuss the effectiveness of strategies used to address challenges of learning an additional language.

D2004C92A2C44F99A33F46720823F987.description: Maintain a learning log to evaluate personal comprehension of language and assess which language learning strategies are most effective.

D27D4A8E46DD4080A13D8C1D4C0E0395.description: Identify similarities and differences in sentence structures between the English and Spanish languages.

BD41A5005A5445B8A25F15FE07C81361.description: Pose questions to examine the intent of a message presented in a text.

3CEEC8D156664ADE82AF940DFB30055D.description: Apply language learning strategies such as: using supplementary information (e.g., prior research, background knowledge and glossaries); interpreting physical (e.g., gestures and facial expressions) and auditory (e.g., tone, laughter and volume) cues; examining context clues and key words to infer the intent of the message; recognizing roots of words to deconstruct their meaning; identifying cognates from English (e.g., hotel - hotel, radio - radio) or from another language (e.g., rose - rosa) to decipher words; using phonics and generalizations to decode individual and compound words; and, looking for patterns and relationships of sentences to interpret meanings of messages.

3134424413E84F0892339367AD1DEFD7.description: Develop tools (e.g., charts, phrasebooks and audio files) and select resources (e.g., electronic applications and grammar reference books) to help construct meaning of oral and written text.

C0FCD7BCF56D48BAA549B0C7676F12A2.description: Prepare to interpret oral and written texts using language learning strategies such as developing predictions and analyzing purpose and context.

47CE1379FBB74CDA86DDFACF1E48A151.description: Select and apply a variety of before, during and after strategies to construct meaning when listening, viewing and reading.

C7CA9E44A3B74C9DA7B9D609417A9454.description: Select and apply a variety of strategies to interpret oral and written texts in Spanish and reflect on personal language learning.
